article.headline: Boeing, 3M share gains contribute to Dow's 435-point rally
article.body: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is rallying Wednesday morning with shares of Boeing and 3M delivering the strongest returns for the index. The Dow DJIA, +0.56% was most recently trading 435 points higher (1.6%), as shares of Boeing BA, -0.39% and 3M MMM, +0.94% have contributed about 25% of the index's intraday rally. Boeing's shares have gained $5.40, or 3.4%, while those of 3M have gained $4.66 (2.9%), combining for a roughly 66-point bump for the Dow. Honeywell International Inc. HON, +0.34%, Caterpillar CAT, +1.45%, and UnitedHealth UNH, +1.68% are also contributing significantly to the gain. A $1 move in any of the Dow's 30 components results in a 6.58-point swing. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
